instruction: Describe the long-term effects of smoking.
output: Smoking can have a wide range of long-term effects on the body. It can increase the risk of developing a number of diseases, including cancer and cardiovascular disease. It can also affect fertility and can increase the risk of developing a variety of respiratory illnesses, such as chronic bronchitis and emphysema. Long-term smoking can also contribute to psychological and mental stress, as well as a deterioration of overall quality of life.
